meanings.definition: The act of placing something in the middle or at the center.
meanings.sent1: The centring of the cake on the table made it look perfect.
meanings.sent2: She carefully adjusted the centring of the painting on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The centring of the toy car on the track was so precise, it looked like magic.
meanings.sent4: His centring of the argument around fairness resonated with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The centring of the spotlight on the singer created a captivating effect on stage.

meanings.definition: A support or framework used to hold something in place.
meanings.sent1: The fragile sculpture needed a strong centring to keep it stable.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers set up the centring before pouring the concrete.
meanings.sent3: The wobbly table was saved by a makeshift centring made of books.
meanings.sent4: Her friends acted as a centring for her during tough times.
meanings.sent5: The centring of the treehouse platform ensured it would withstand any storm.

meanings.definition: The process of focusing or aligning something.
meanings.sent1: His centring on the task at hand helped him finish it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The photographer's centring of the shot captured the essence of the moment.
meanings.sent3: The centring of her thoughts on positivity brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The coach's centring of the team's efforts led to a victory.
meanings.sent5: The centring of the telescope on the stars revealed a breathtaking view.
